body_html:
The usual usage of tensorflow is that people develop the algorithms in python. It is much easier. Plus you can visualize the results and what not.

The deployment is typically done by taking calling a few functions and using algorithm serialized in proto. See the android example. Minimal interface (TensorflowClassifier.java) and one protobuf blob (tensorflow_inception_graph.pb).

People are really doing it this way. It is easier. But of course it is completely fine doing all in C++. Look for the macros "REGISTER_*". I found those useful to see understand the interaction with python.

body:
The usual usage of tensorflow is that people develop the algorithms in python. It is much easier. Plus you can visualize the results and what not.

The deployment is typically done by taking calling a few functions and using algorithm serialized in proto. See the android example. Minimal interface ([TensorflowClassifier.java](/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/android/src/org/tensorflow/demo/TensorflowClassifier.java)) and one protobuf blob ([tensorflow_inception_graph.pb](/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/android/assets/tensorflow_inception_graph.pb)).

People are really doing it this way. It is easier. But of course it is completely fine doing all in C++. Look for the macros "REGISTER_*". I found those useful to see understand the interaction with python.
